publicationStmt.publisher: Uppsala University, Department of linguistics and philology

msContents.summary: Translations of Biblical texts into North-Western Karaim: The Latter Prophets, The Twelve Minor Prophets, the Sifrei Emet (Psalms, Proverbs, Job), and the Five Megillot (Song of Songs, Ruth, Lamentations, Ecclesiastes, Esther)

ab.title: Psalms 4
ab.l: Č́eb́ar avaz ḱot́uŕuv́č́uǵa čozmaḥ savutlary byla miźmoru David́niń. Čaɣyrɣanymda qaruv b́ergiń maja rast Teńrim tar bolɣanda maja avlaḥ et́kiń maja ḥajyfsunɣun da ešit́kiń tefilamny .
Adam ulanlary qačanɣa dejiń syjymny qojarsyz iḿańč́- ḱa śuv́aŕsiź bošluḥnu iźĺaŕsiź aldavluḥnu hamḿeš́a.
Da bilijiź ki ajyrdy H ḥasid́ kišini öźuńa H ešit́adir čaɣyrɣanymda anar.
Titrajiź da jazyḥly bolmajyz anar ajtyjyz juŕagijiźd́a t́oš́agijiź üśt́uńa da tyjyltyn tefila etijiź anar hamḿeš́a.
D́eb́eḥa etijiź rast d́eb́eḥalar da išanyjyz H-ɣa.
Ḱopĺar ajtadyrlar kim ḱoŕǵuźur biźǵa jaḥšyny balqyt- ḥyn üśt́uḿuźǵa jaryḥlyɣyn qyblalaryjnyn e H.
B́erdij bijańč́ juŕagim- d́a artyḥ ńe vaḥttan b́uŕt́ukĺari da šarb́et́ĺari artsalar.
Tynč- lyḥ byla birǵa jatsam da jukĺarmiń ki śeń H jalɣyzov emińlik byla tynč et́arsiń maja.

app.note: According to KRPS, the North-Western Karaim form would be tefiŋla (522), the form tefila and tefilla can be detected in South-Western Karaim and Eastern Karaim (568).
